column22: If someone is suspected to have COVID-19, place them in a separate room, preferably with a toilet and sink. If medical isolation is not feasible, attempt to place beds 6 feet apart and provide sick individuals with masks.

If someone has flu-like symptoms, they will be isolated for testing and the unit where the patient was housed or worked prior to isolation will be quarantined until either a negative test is confirmed or for 14 days if the test is positive. If those who are quarantined become sick, the 14 days starts over.
